Now the Trump administration is expanding access so that people who don't want to pay for insurance that meets Affordable Care Act standards or who don't qualify for subsidies can find coverage.
More than 80 percent of people who buy insurance on the ACA exchanges get subsidies to help pay for it, but there's no government help for short-term plans.

They may want something.

That's because these short-term term policies don't have to meet the Affordable Care Act rules.
They don't have to cover people with ongoing health problems and usually cover fewer services than required under the ACA.
